t: Luke 12
Beware of the Leaven of the Pharisees

In*p the meantime, when so many thousands of the people had gathered together that they were trampling one another, he began to say to his disciples first, “Beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees,*r which*r is*r hypocrisy.*r
Nothing*r is*r covered*r up*r that*r will*r not*r be*r revealed,*r or*r hidden*r that*r will*r not*r be*r known.*r

The Parable of the Rich Fool
Someone*p in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
But he said to him, “Man,*r who*r made*r me*r a*r judge*r or*r arbitrator*r over*r you?”*r

And he told them a parable, saying, “The*r land*r of*r a*r rich*r man*r produced*r plentifully,*r
and*r he*r thought*r to*r himself,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do,*r for*r I*r have*r nowhere*r to*r store*r my*r crops?’*r

Do Not Be Anxious
And*p he said to his disciples, “Therefore*r I*r tell*r you,*r do*r not*r be*r anxious*r about*r your*r life,*r what*r you*r will*r eat,*r nor*r about*r your*r body,*r what*r you*r will*r put*r on.*r

Peter*p said, “Lord, are you telling this parable for us or for all?”
